intro: Ruellia angustior, commonly known as narrowleaf ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy blue or purple flowers. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types. Ruellia angustior is also valued for its ability to thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
